intro: Verbascum jankaeanum, commonly known as the Jankaean mullein, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, covered with dense, woolly hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers arranged in a spike, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are large, lance-shaped, and covered with a thick layer of soft, fuzzy hair. Verbascum jankaeanum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
